docs.title: Simple AI - Bridging the Gap with AI For Everyone
docs.text: Enabling everyone unfamiliar with programming languages to easily engage with AI and open the doors to the world of the future.

docs.title: Contributing to AI For Beginner
docs.text: We want to make contributing to this project as easy and transparent as possible.

docs.title: Forking this Repository:
docs.text: Fork the simple-ai repository into your own workspace.

docs.title: Cloning the Repository to Your Workspace:
Setting Upstream Remote:
docs.text:
```shell= $ git remote add upstream git@github.com:1chooo/simple-ai.git

$ git remote -v origin git@github.com:/simple-ai.git (fetch) origin git@github.com:/simple-ai.git (push) upstream git@github.com:1chooo/simple-ai.git (fetch) upstream git@github.com:1chooo/simple-ai.git (push) ```

docs.title: Pull Requests:
docs.text: If you have any valuable ideas to contribute, please create a pull request and provide details about the outstanding work you've done.

docs.title: Issue Reporting:
docs.text: If you encounter any problems while contributing to this project, please report the issues in the simple-ai/issues section.

docs.title: Important Notes:
docs.text: [!IMPORTANT] Remember to synchronize and update your repository before starting to write code each time.

docs.title: Make sure to synchronize and update your repository before initiating a pull request:
docs.text:
1. Run git stash save to temporarily stash your local changes.
  2. Run git fetch upstream to sync the source project with your local copy.
  3. Run git checkout main to switch to the main branch.
  4. Run git merge upstream/main to merge the updated remote version into your local copy. If there are no conflicts, the update process is complete.
  5. Run git stash pop to apply your temporarily stashed changes back to your working directory. Resolve any conflicts if necessary.

docs.text: • 教學課程：使用 S3 Object Lambda 轉換應用程式的資料

docs.text: • Docker 基本觀念與使用教學：自行建立 Docker 影像檔

docs.title: Developing
docs.text:
To test the function, navigate to the test/ directory. However, if importing the Refinaid package is unsuccessful, you can resolve this issue by adding the following code at the beginning of your test script. This code snippet allows you to return to the project root directory.

import sys
from os.path import join
from os.path import dirname
from os.path import abspath

project_root = join(
    dirname(abspath(__file__)),
    '..', 
)
sys.path.append(project_root)
